title: Quarto Basics
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()








Figure 1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: R. Daniel Jonsson
text: Various writings on transport systems analysis and loosely related topics.

title: R. Daniel Jonsson
text:
Selected projects







2000 – 2003
PROSPECTS: Procedures for Recommending Optimal Sustainable Planning of European City Transport Systems, EU 5th framework project in cooperation with: Institute of Transport Studies, Leeds; Institute for Transport Economics, Oslo; Institute for Traffic Planning & Traffic Engineering, Vienna; VTT Building and Transport, Helsinki; Universidad Politechnica de Madrid.


2004 – 2005
Development of activity based models for the Stockholm Region. Vinnova.


2004 – 2008
Modelling and analysis of a sustainable land use and transport system. Vinnova, Vägverket.


2007 – 2010
Assessment of long term effects of economic policy instruments on the transport system. Vinnova, Vägverket.


2009 – 2011
Efficient transport models. In cooperation with WSP. Vägverket.


2010
Modelling congesting charging in Stockholm. Vinnova.


2010 – 2012
Förutsättningarnas betydelse för den relativa samhällsekonomiska lönsamheten av investeringar. Vinnova.


2010 – 2012
The long-term social benefits of public transport. Vinnova.


2011 – 2016
Post Car(d) Urbanism - Scenarios and visualizations of transformed urban landscapes. Formas.


2012 – 2014
Energieffektivisering, transportpolitik och regionförstoring. Energimyndigheten.


2012 – 2016
Regionala systemanalyser. Trafikverket.


2014 – 2016
Estimation and development of a new national transport model system for Sweden. Trafikverket


2014 – 2016
Systems effects of autonomous vehicles. Energimyndigheten


2017 – 2020
MISTRA SAMS


2022 – 2023
Scenario planning with synthetic populations. Region Stockholm.

title: R. Daniel Jonsson
text:
Degrees







2001
M.Sc. Engineering Physics, specialised in Scientific Computing, Uppsala University.


2004
Licentiate of Engineering, Infrastructure, KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm


2009
Ph.D. in Infrastructure, KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm.

title: R. Daniel Jonsson
text:
Current activity
I am a research scientist at the division of Systems Analysis and Economics, department of Urban Planning and Environment, KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm.
Since 2018 – KTH Partner director for the Strategic Partnership between KTH and Region Stockholm regarding transport and regional planning.
Since 2022 – KTH Partner contact EIT Urban Mobility, an initiative of the European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT).
If there was such a field as Complexity Regional Science I would probably be working in it.
